subject: Re: [junit] Testing API where order in which methods are invoked matters
msgSnippet: ... If this object is expensive to get, it would be nice to make that cheaper, and work out how to carve out the expensive bits and not use them when
messageBody:
On Tuesday 28 June 2005 14:56, Cedric Beust wrote:

> If this object is expensive to get, it would be nice to save it in-between
> invocations, which brings us back to maintaining state and ordering
> methods.

If this object is expensive to get, it would be nice to make that cheaper,
and work out how to carve out the expensive bits and not use them when
unnecessary.

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
It's called *extreme* programming, not *stupid* programming.
